question: A 6-year-old child has an accident and had fracture elbow, after 4 years presented with tingling and numbness in the ulnar side of finger, fracture is:
exp: (b) Dislocation of elbow- Fracture elbow with tingling subsequently after few years--"Tardy ulnar nerve palsy". Most common cause is fracture lateral condyle humerus.

question: Fracture shaft of humerus damages which nerve?
exp: ANSWER: (A) Radial nerve. REF: Snell's anatomy 7th ed p. 484. Radial nerve injury is seen in: Fracture shaft of humerus. Saturday night palsy. Injection palsy. Features of radial nerve injury: Sensory loss over area supplied by posterior cutaneous nerve of forearm. Wrist, thumb and finger extension is lost.

question: Axillary nerve damage is caused by damage to?
exp: Ans. (b) Surgical neck humerus. Ref. '. Grant's atlas of anatomy, 12/e, p 524)

question: In fracture of surgical neck of humerus which nerve is involved?
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., Axillary Site of injury. Nerve injured. Fracture surgical neck humerus. Axillary nerve. Fracture shaft humerus. Radial nerve. Supracondylar fracture. Median nerve (anterior interosseous branch). Medial epicondyle fracture. Ulnar nerve. Posterior dislocation of HIPSciatic nerve. Fibular neck fracture. Common peroneal nerve

question: Fracture shaft of humerus causes damage to?
exp: ANSWER: (D) Radial nerve. REF: Keith and Moore's anatomy 4th ed p. 761. Radial nerve injury is commonly associated with: Fracture shaft of humerus. Saturday night palsy. Injection palsy

question: Hanging cast is used for-
exp: Ans. is 'c' i. e.. Humerus fracture Name of the case. Useo Minerva cast. Cervical spine diseaseo Risser's cast. Scoliosiso Turn-buckle cast. Scoliosiso Shoulder spica. Shoulder immobilisationo U-slab. Fracture of the humeruso Hanging cast. Fracture of the humeruso Code's cast. Colles' fractureo Hip spica. Fracture of the femuro Cylinder cast. Fracture of the patellao PTB cast. Fracture of the tibia

question: A patient had met with an accident and he can not abduct his right arm and can not lift it. On examination tenderness felt near right upper arm. X-ray showed fracture surgical neck of humerus. Muscle that was paralyzed was:
exp: (b) Supraspinatus. The best answer here is deltoid (axillary nerve) since it is not mentioned, so we choose supraspinatus (suprascapular nerve).

question: Which nerve is damaged in fracture surgical neck humerus -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., Axillary Complications of fracture surgical neck humeruso Shoulder stiffness. o Axillary nerve is particularly vulnerable, both from the injury and from surgeryo Axillary artery injury o Malunion o Nonunion o Myositis ossificans
